summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Activity Report for August 4, 2019, detailing staffing shortages, inmate counts, and administrative leave. It is significant as it provides a snapshot of the facility's operations shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's death there on August 10, 2019, noting an inmate on suicide watch with a companion.

events.title: MCC New York Daily Operations
events.description: Routine daily operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, marked by significant staff shortages leading to unassigned correctional posts on the morning and day watches.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The report documents operations at the MCC New York on August 4, 2019, five days before Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell.
It notes significant staff shortages, with posts like '7 North', '10 south #2', and 'SHU #3' being unassigned due to a lack of staff.
The report lists one inmate (I/M) on 'Suicide Watch w/inmate companion', a critical detail given subsequent events.
The total inmate population at the beginning of the morning watch on August 4, 2019, was 762.
The document is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' and is part of the SDNY (Southern District of New York) case files related to Epstein.
